item.description:
Hi everybody.  There is a change of time for The Princess of Montpensier.  It is now 7:00 pm.  Se everyone at 6:45 pm in the lobby.

 

This film was shown at the Palm Springs Film Festival in Jan 2011.  There were two films there that dealt with the same time period, 16th century France.  I didn't see this one, but it got excellent reviews.  In French with subtitles.

Bertrand Tavernier is in top form with this gripping, suberbly mounted drama set against the savage Catholic/Protestant wars that ripped apart France in the 16th century.  Based on a novella by the celebrated Madame de Lafayete, the action centers on the love of Marie de Mezieres for her dashing cousin Henri de Guise, (future Henry 4th) thwarted when her father's political ambitions force her into marriage with the well-connected Philipe de Montpensier whom she has never met.  When Philippe is called away to fight, she is left in the care of Count Chabannes, an aging nobleman with a disdain for warfare and soon becomes exposed to the sexual and political intrigues of the court.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: The Princess of Monpensier
